description: title says all. i needed a screenshot tool, tried this one first, and have never had a problem.

Since I updated to FEDORA 40 this stopped working :(

Please bring this app back!
I can get it to open, but I can't get it to take screenshots. and if I try changing settings, it crashes. Not currently functional with fedora 40
Like others have stated about using on Fedora 40. Any type of capture results in the error: "Unable to show image".
summary: Does not work on Plasma Wayland

description: It won't allow me to take screenshots, making it useless

No matter what keyboard shortcut I use, it simply doesn't take a screenshot. I have to manually right click on the icon in the top panel to take a screenshot, however; it does not open the editor nor it saves the screenshot.

It just pops up a notification "Unable to show image." I tried every options but it won't work. I feel like this could've been one of the best screenshot apps based on the features, but it just doesn't work. (I- I'm not saying it... btw-)
Best screenshot and anotation app for Linux
Best screenshot app
I was trying to look for alternatives to Windows snip & sketch, and this is wayy better than that. Happy with the quality, thanks to the developer for making this.
Really cool and awesome!

I was looking alternative for windows's ShareX app. And this do the job very well. The anotation's are fantastic, even better than ShareX Numbering pins, outlines, text tool and arrows are superb. 

I still have to figure out shortcuts working. And I'm a little missing how ShareX snapping to the portions of window, as well as having an ability of mp4/gif record of the portion of the screen.

good jobs overall. Highly recommented!
fail with Ubuntu 20.04 Lts
sometimes it shows up thinst eve.seidenthal@gmail.comon the screen which make no sense, cut windows which i am sure not having selected.
I didn't figure it out how I can set the app to automatically close after a screenshot. Other than that, it works great for me, all I need is there.
basic first editing like adding arrows or Text after a screenshot is usefull and fast.
The number tool is really good. Automatically counts up. Watermark option is a nice touch.
This is the only screenshot tool I've found for KDE that lets me easily edit the screenshots taken (annotate, draw on, etc.). Others claim to, but only ksnip has worked as described.

Would be great ... if it worked.
Freezes when saving (version 1.7.2. on Kubuntu 20.04).
This was working great until recently. Now it will not open. Very disappointing.
I like that you can mark and edit the screenshot before using it.
Can u explain me about this store?? Why installing app about 15 MB taken 15 minutes??? WHY??? WHY??? WHY??? WHY??? WHY??? WHY???
Tried Flameshot first and did not even open. This works better then the snippingTool on Windows.
Would be nice if it automatically copies the screenshots to the clipboard.
Works great with Ubuntu.
Screenshots made on a Hi-DPI monitor are zoomed in (shown at half-resolution) and can't be zoomed out, which makes them very hard to annotate.
summary: Unusable without a zoom feature on a Hi-DPI screen

description: Very intuitive for users of MS Snipping Tool, who want a replacement while using Fedora.  Could do without having boarders all the time, and it takes some working around.  But other than that, great stuff.
summary: Very good, works as an excellent alternative to MS-SnipTool

description:
Notice the projects Git has an upgraded version (at time of posting it's 1.8). 
Is the flatpak going to follow their release schedule or is this a one time flatpak.
summary: New Version? Is Flatpak going to upgrade auto?

description: Fedora 33 with defaults
Thanks, screenshot tool very useful
Great! What I expected of it to do.
summary: Great! What I expected of it to do

description: New tabs for each screenshot are really handy and very easy to annotate
Simple, and easy to set up. Would recommend to anyone.
summary: Best screenshot app i've tried in linux

description: Works with Wayland !

So far, this is the only app/utility that I've seen in Linux that is absolutely professionally written without bugs. So far, every single setting I've tried, WORKS - properly. I am so happy to have found this. Thank you so much, Damir, for such care in writing this. This the ONLY snip (in Linux) that saves a file AND puts in the clipboard - BOTH at the same time, without a lot of fuss. 

I was a systems-analyst/ programmer/ interface designer before I retired 20 years ago, but I'm fairly new to Linux, and I was dispairing of every finding any app that completely worked correctly, settings and all - every time. Great job programming this one. A programmer after my own heart.

Only on MY wish list would be a setting to ask you for a fileNAME (for overwriting the default (or not) if the setting was checked). To press enter to keep the default file name, or just start typing to overwrite it - but only if the "ask for filename" setting was checked. If not checked, the fabulously easy "save with default filename and put into clipboard" with nothing extraneous, would operate as beautifully as it does now.

I also appreciate being able to edit the default Save directory, and also being able to assign cursor/line colors to something very visible to me.

Again, thank you, you solved one of my "Can I live with Linux?" dilemmas. I use a lot of screen clips (rectangular). 

One question: Why is the PrintScreen key not assignable as a kb shortcut key?

Kudos,
Anne Fennell
x.computer@gmx.com
That is what I was looking for. Easy to use, fast starting screenshot-utility with the ability to edit the captured picture in an easy way - great app!

The best annotation ever! 

Keep it up and stable
I can not see any other feature I require. It has everything a snipping tool should have. What a great job.
summary: Easily the best Snipping tool I have ever used!

description: works with gnome, wayland etc...
So many bugs on system with two displays... (Fedora 34)
When I moved away from Windows and .NET I needed a replacement for ShareX and this has all the same features I was missing. Great app.

Lots of features. Works in both wayland and xorg. good snap support.
Developer is responsive and passionate about the quality of his work.
summary: My favourite screenshot tool across distros

description:
You can even use it to edit existing image files.

ksnip -e image_file.png
Does exactly what a screenshot tool should do.

In version 1.9.0 it not allows to select mode first so you have to make a screenshot and after that you can choose. Seriously? Why? It was perfect.
Though the app is very useful!
not working for me with 2x LCD.
Not working after upgrade Fedora 34 to 35 version. :/
summary: Great app, but not working on FEDORA 35

description: Not worked after update Fedora34 to Fedora 35..(((((
It launches, let you select an area of the screen, but does not actually take the screenshot. Another broken screenshot tool ...
summary: Fourth screenshot tool I test on Fedora 35 that is broken

description: Tried it, but it doesn't capture rectangular areas, instead it captures the entire viewport with a random window in the foreground (not the one I'm trying to capture).
Doesn't let you resize the editor window
Coming from flameshot and spectacle, this tool is so simple yet powerful. We can leverage tabs functionality to have multiple screenshots edited at once!
Serious issues with customizable rectange snipping.
Easy and powerful
To get rectangular snipps you need to take a screenshot of the whole screen and then Edit it, which is a pain in the ass compared to ease of Snipping Tool in Windows.
summary: Only good if you use it for screenshots

description:
I saw a couple of reviews of issues with rectangular screenshots.  I am not seeing any issues whatsoever. I tested all aspects of the app and it has been flawless. Maybe this app was affected by a third party library that has been fixed?  I am on KDE NEON which uses very current libraries.

I can select a piece of a window, copy, edit etc..  Its very nice. I find this app close to the greenshot app on windows, only with more features.
It takes the full screen at the beginning then you can take a part of the screen. Why is that? At least give a chance to change this behavior
summary: fullscreen shot at the start is a pain

description: It's a great app for what it's supposed to do, but sometimes it just won't start and I have to reboot my system to make it work.

Works perfectly, including on Wayland in Gnome on Fedora (unlike Flameshot as of this writing) and it also allows for editing and drawing arrows, boxes, etc. Which I consider critical in a screenshot tool.
It grabs the whole screen now. It used to let you select the area of the screen every time. If I want to grab the whole screen, I'll just use alt+printscreen. Uninstalled.
summary: Needs to go back to how it used to be

description:
I want a tool to easily capture a selected area and then copy it to the clipboard, at a perfect moment. 
ksnip was able to do that in the version before that.
With the new version i need to do 5 or more clicks which destoys the usability. So its time to search for another tool.
Sad example of how Linux devs work against each other
summary: Cumbersome and limited by compatibility issues

description:
ksnip is very good app.
the feature is enough for my daily task.
thank you for the team.
The app apparently has some compatibility issues now, it does not display menu text any more and spams the terminal with "fontconfig error"s. Unusable.

Seems like the update destroyed the essence of ksnip... shame.
I used it as a windows "snipping" tool replacement. Now you have to take a screenshot of the whole screen and cant grap a rectuangular area anymore.
summary: Seems like the update destroyed the essence of ksnip... shame

description:
As of the ~September update pretty much unusable like others have said. Like me, most people want to be able to select part of the screen to grab. The print screen button grabs the whole screen anyway. 
You should at least be able to set the default to grab part of the screen.
Developer - think again! This was a great little tool.

I give it 5 stars as I love it how it used to work.
The last update in September destroyed it. Before it, it was the best screenshot program on Ubuntu.
summary: Unusable after the update in september 2022

description: For the short time I used it, I have no major issues. Fast, and many fun tools to use. I find it isn't what I needed, it doesn't show screenshot as fit to screen in the editor. Maybe it can but I can't find the option. Settings like preset name is harder to configure than Flameshot. For me I need something simpler.
summary: Works well, but is not for me

description:
Couple of years ago I spent some time looking for convenient application for taking and annotating screenshotes. ksnip was the best.
Recently I upgraded to Ubuntu 22.04 and suddenly found that ksnip didn't work as before anymore... There was really strange behavior. But then I realized that all applications for taking screenshotes work in strange way. And it appeared that the reason is that Ununtu 22.04 uses Wayland. And you actually can disable it. And after that ksnip works exactly as it worked in Ubuntu 20.04.
summary: Best application for taking and annotating screenshotes

description: best tools, recommend
perfect! add notices on screenshoots it's simple and fast. Thanks for author!

Works really well, even provides blur/pixilate tools for obviscating data.
Dropped the flatpak rating down one star for asking for access to all system files by default. Use flatseal to remove that permission, and just give it access to folders you need. I mostly just edit, copy, and paste images into other apps anyway.
summary: Well done app. Has all the features I would expect

description: Does exactly what you'd expect with some great annotation tools too. Thanks!
There are some points to be improved, but it is very good.

I've been using ksnip as my dedicated screenshot and annotation/documentation app since i discovered it. this is a well designed tool that has every feature missing from other screenshot apps, including how light it is to have open. you can even take rapid fire screenshots if you're documenting instructions over a video meeting. perfect for students of remote instruction courses.
App opens, but nothing happens when clicking the new Screenshot button. I used to love this program.
summary: Doesn't work after upgrading to Ubuntu 22

description: On Fedora 38 now and can't take any screenshots with the app.
Tested 4 other screen grabbers, this one has tools that work.
on ubuntu 22.04, you must compile qt5, ocr plugin manually, which can not be done now.
Having linked area capture to a shortcut, everytime I attempt to use it, I cannot drag or make a selection to screenshot, rendering the app useless.

used to be a functiona app, but now has been "upgraded" and reuires a bunch of menu clicking to copy and paste. this becomes an absolute pain when attempting to accomplish tasks and you spend more time delaing with popup menus that getting work done.
I really like it, great tool if you quickly want to point something out on a screen. Great tool for anyone who works remotely!
summary: Great To Get Your Point Accross

```
Critical: Invalid reply from DBus: Screenshot is not allowed
```

Not working on Fedora 39.

FINALLY a screenshot tool that works!!

Ubuntu 22.04
KDE Plasma 5.24.7

summary: Does not work on Fedora 39 Gnome

description: It's ok, and it gets the job done for the most part, but lacks in major areas. Cropping is near-impossible, cropping the image in a completely different area than what you select. There is no option to highlight an area smaller than a window to capture. I think people have been giving poor software grace simply because they are open-source and "anti-proprietary." Beware, open source software =/= good software. In fact I've seen it tending to correlate to the opposite.
Doesn´t work on Ubuntu 23.10
Love it, few th ings can be improved. Controls over what kind of number i want to add. But overall love it.
Works well and does the job. with easy access to past screenshots by tabs.
it won't open on fedora
It saves very different image area than the one selected and shown.
Super screenshot tool, now also with sticky function!
After testing various Screenshot-Tools ksnip is the best one for me. It´s easy and has all functions I need. Never had any issues.
Maybe a wayland problem?

Die vorige Version bestach duch die Einfachheit. Nun sind unsinnige Funktionen dazugekommen, die sich nicht umgehen lassen. Es wird grundsätzlich immer ein kompletter screeshot gemacht, statt standardmäßig ein Ausschnitt anzubieten. Und dann wird gefragt, ob ich das "freigeben" will...

Muy buena aplicación para hacer capturas de pantalla y luego poderlas editar fácilmente dentro de la misma aplicación.
Ligera y últil.
Un 10.
Excelente, tiene todas las funcionalidades que tiene que tener.
muy buena y tiene muchas funciones

Muy buena, para lo simple y portatil que es ?️
?️
summary: Muy buena, portatil y muy completa

description: Usaba Shutter pero me resultaba poco ágil. Buscaba algo más rápido y que permitiera editar la imágen dentro de la misma aplicación. Ksnip es lo que buscaba.
Comparado con otras que he probado es la mejor con diferencia.
Excelente, usaba greenshot en windows y no encontraba una herramienta similar o al nivel en linux. Esta definitivamente es justo lo que necesitaba.
Muy buena, con funciones muy interesantes!
Todavia no esta completamente soportado Plasma en Wayland, pero es tan bueno su editor que me es útil para hacer anotaciones y marcas sobre archivos de imagenes.
summary: Muy buena app. Es muy bueno el editor incorporado

description: It can´t save a screenshot. Don´t use it.
NO SIRVE CON SCROLL EN UBUNTU 22.04
summary: NO SIRVE CON SCROLL EN UBUNTU 22.04

description: Lo instalé con el paquete deb pero no funcona nada. No abre.

Je découvre avec plaisir ce remplaçant du très regretté "Shutter"
Permet les anotations à la volée sans ouvrir de logiciels tiers.
Parfait pour expliquer à quelqu’un avec quelques flèches numérotées et incrustation de texte, comment procéder en quelques secondes.
Floutage , surlignage en deux clics. 
Que demander de mieux ? 
Une gomme peut être, pour éviter de passer par sélection et touche suppr, mais c’est vraiment pour finasser.
Un grand merci pour cette appli.
summary: Le meilleur après le regretté Shutter

description:
Il ne manque rien, mais alors rien.
Comme il sait aussi prendre en charge le presse-papier, CTRL+ALT+Impr et hop, CTRL+V et je copie une fenêtre dans l'outil. J'annote, et c'est fait.
C'est pratique, c'est rapide, c'est intelligent, et c'est utile.
Le meilleur logiciel de capture d'écran.

Pour faire une capture basique, j'utilise l'outil de base d'UBUNTU.
Par contre si j'ai besoin d'éditer ma capture KSNIP est top !
Assez intuitif, précis pour la capture, c'est un très bon logiciel.
Vraiment je recommande.
Bravo pour le boulot !
simple et efficace
Лучшая замена оконным ножницам!
Первый запуск был ок. Второй раз некоторое время не запускался, потом всё же заработал. Всё, больше войти в программу не получилось.
добавьте пожалуйста возможность работать сеткой, чтобы можео было выравнивать аннотации
скачивал как аналог ножниц, которые были на виндоус. Такое же простое, только настроек тут больше.

Отличная замена стандартному Spectacle. В отличие от, научился сохранять параметры инструментов. Ну и в целом бОльшее количество настроек и возможностей. Пользуюсь пару месяцев, особых проблем не заметил
